articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: United Nations Secretary-General Antonio Guterres has added Israel's military to a global list of offenders who have committed violations against children, said Israel's U.N. envoy Gilad Erdan, describing the decision as "shameful."
articles.title: UN chief to call out Israel for violations against children

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: With no sign of progress in mediators' efforts to reach a ceasefire in the Gaza war, Israeli forces pounded Rafah from the air and ground overnight as tanks tried to advance further west, residents said.
articles.title: Israeli forces step up bombing of Rafah, tanks push west

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin said on Friday there was no need to use nuclear weapons to deliver victory for Moscow in Ukraine, the strongest signal yet from the Kremlin chief that there will not be a nuclear strike.
articles.title: Putin says Russia does not need to use nuclear weapons for victory in Ukraine

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine has the right according to international law to attack legitimate military targets in Russia to defend itself, NATO Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg said during a visit to new alliance member Sweden on Friday.
articles.title: Ukraine has right to strike targets in Russia, NATO's Stoltenberg says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine and Moldova meet all the criteria needed to formally start negotiations on EU membership, the European Commission said on Friday, as Ukrainian Prime Minister Denys Shmyhal expressed hope that the talks could start later this month.
articles.title: EU executive says Ukraine, Moldova ready to start EU accession talks

articles.author: Nellie Peyton, Tannur Anders
articles.description: South African opposition parties said on Friday they were waiting for more details on a proposal by the African National Congress to form a government of national unity after it lost its majority for the first time in the democratic era.
articles.title: South African parties await details of ANC unity government proposal

articles.author: Crispian Balmer, Andreas Rinke
articles.description: Diplomats preparing for next week's Group of Seven (G7) leaders' summit will need to be creative to find ways to leverage profits generated by Russian assets frozen in the West and help Ukraine, officials said on Friday.
articles.title: Diplomatic creativity needed to resolve Russian asset plan, official says

articles.author: Guy Faulconbridge, Vladimir Soldatkin
articles.description: Cut off from the West, Russia is pitching its $2 trillion economy to giants like China and Saudi Arabia and longer-term prospects like Zimbabwe and Afghanistan at its premier investment forum in St Petersburg, which was founded by the tsars as a window to Europe.
articles.title: Amid war, Putin looks east from Russia's window to Europe

articles.author: Nafisa Eltahir
articles.description: Refugees from Sudan's civil war who fled into neighbouring Ethiopia say they have been forced to move on again and take shelter in a forest and on roadsides after repeated attacks by gunmen left their tents pock-marked with bullet holes.
articles.title: Attacks leave Sudanese refugees stranded in Ethiopian forest

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Vietnam has been increasing its dredging and landfill work in the South China Sea, creating almost as much new land as in the previous two years combined, setting the stage for a record year of island-building, U.S. researchers said on Friday.
articles.title: Vietnam speeding up South China Sea island-building pace, US researchers say
